solution_line_template: The vehicle's speed decreases to {initial_speed} x {speed_decrease_percent} = <<{initial_speed}*{speed_decrease_percent}={ascending_speed}>>{ascending_speed} miles per hour when ascending to the top of the mountain.

So, the total time Crystal will have to spend going to the top of the mountain is {distance_to_top} / {ascending_speed} = <<{distance_to_top}/{ascending_speed}={time_ascending}>>{time_ascending} hours.

And the speed of the vehicle increases by {initial_speed} x {speed_increase_percent} = <<{initial_speed}*{speed_increase_percent}={speed_increase_amount}>>{speed_increase_amount} miles per hour when going down to the foot of the mountain.
So, the total speed of the vehicle when going down is {initial_speed} + {speed_increase_amount} = <<{initial_speed}+{speed_increase_amount}={descending_speed}>>{descending_speed} miles per hour.

Thus, Chrystal will have to spend {distance_down_mountain} / {descending_speed} = <<{distance_down_mountain}/{descending_speed}={time_descending}>>{time_descending} hours to descend from the mountain.
Therefore, the total hours she will spend to pass the whole mountain is {time_ascending} + {time_descending} = <<{time_ascending}+{time_descending}={total_time}>>{total_time} hours.
